/* Early years */ Huh? Hirohito insisted on non-public trials which sentenced many of the ring-leaders to death (Bix, p. 301, Mosley, p. 146)
Add mention of the February 1936 attempted military coup which Hirohito personally helped suppress
/* References */ Add Behr's book, comments about some of the other ones
/* Divinity */ Removed link to Nin'gen'-sengen from ''See Also''; it's linked one line above
adding [[Category:1901 births]] [[Category:1989 deaths]] based on [[List of people by name]], see [[Wikipedia:People by year|WP:People by year]]
argue it in talk, but i can't think of any emperor who saw more change.

Quite right, it was December 7th in the USA: however it was December the 8th in both Japan (which is the relevant place in this context) and also in SE Asia
Corrected information, It was on December 7,1941 that Pearl Harbor Hawaii was attacked, NOT on December 8th as previously indicated. changed information to reflect correct information.
date of surrender, reasons for surrender.

who the heck wrote hirohito is a family name? Japanese emperors have no family name because emperors gave a surname to his people to govern them
